text: Hey everyone, hoping someone can point me in the right direction, adding new content to a HubSpot boilerplate page, content is automatically wrapped by both a Column and a Section, both of which we have control over margins/padding.  Where do those defaults live?  i.e. Sections automatically apply 80px top/bottom spacing, Columns add 20px left/right spacing, we'd like to change these defaults
<@U6W3H6YN8> You can add us to that beta list :slightly_smiling_face:

Hey Jay :wave: if you are using the default boilerplate the column padding can be found here (<https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/main/src/css/objects/_containers-dnd.css#L17>) and the section padding can be found here (<https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/main/src/css/theme-overrides.css#L107>). The section padding variable is added towards the top of that same file here (<https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/main/src/css/theme-overrides.css#L34>) and that pulls from theme settings (<https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/main/src/fields.json#L571>).
